intro: Balanites mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé balanite, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its deciduous nature, shedding its leaves during the dry season. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing flat, bean-like seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and along riverbanks. The species is of interest for its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
